sen.j: 喜子内親王（きし（よしこ）ないしんのう、生没年不詳）は、平安時代末期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Kishi (Kishi (Yoshiko) Naishinno, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of Imperial family in the end of Heian period.
Imperial Princess Kishi (Kishi/Yoshiko Naishinno, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family in the end of Heian period.
Imperial Princess Kishi (also known as Yoshiko, years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family in the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: also known as 補足用語統一

sen.e: She was Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was an Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was an Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 第73代堀河天皇の皇女で、母は不詳。
sen.e: She was Princess of seventy-third Emperor Horikawa, and her mother is not known.
She was a Princess of the 73rd Emperor, Horikawa, and her mother is not known.
She was a Princess of the 73rd Emperor, Horikawa, and her mother is not known.

sen.j: 仁平元年（1151年）3月内親王宣下を受け、妍子内親王（鳥羽天皇皇女）と交代する形で、甥近衛天皇の斎宮に卜定された。
sen.e: In March 1151, she was conferred as Imperial Princess by Emperor, and taking place of Imperial Princess Kenshi (Princess of Emperor Toba), she was selected by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) as Saigu for Emperor Konoe, her nephew.

In March 1151, she was named an Imperial Princess by the Emperor, and took the place of Imperial Princess Kenshi (Princess of Emperor Toba), she was selected through divination to be a Saigu for Emperor Konoe, her nephew.

In March 1151, she was named an Imperial Princess by the Emperor, and took the place of Imperial Princess Kenshi (Princess of Emperor Toba), she was selected bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) to be a Saigu for Emperor Konoe, her nephew.

sen.j: 同年9月初斎院（一本御書所）に入る。
sen.e: In September of the same year, she entered Shosaiin (hall of initial abstinence) (Ippon Goshodokoro).
In September of the same year, she entered Shosaiin (hall of initial abstinence) (Ippon Goshodokoro).
sen.cmt: I don't know what to do with “Shosaiin (hall of initial abstinence)” or “Ippon Goshodokoro”, but I don't think the meaning would be clear to a reader
sen.e: In October of the same year, she entered Shosaiin (hall of initial abstinence) (Ippon Goshodokoro).

sen.j: 仁平2年（1152年）9月野宮に入り、翌年の仁平3年（1153年）9月、伊勢へ群行した。
sen.e: In September 1152, she entered Nonomiya (temporary palace for Saigu to be purified), and in September of the next year, 1153, she made Gunko (Saigu heading to Ise after the purification in Nonomiya) to Ise.

In September 1152, she entered Nonomiya (temporary palace for Saigu to be purified), and in September of the next year, 1153, she made Gunko (Saigu heading to Ise after the purification in Nonomiya) to Ise.
In October 1152, she entered Nonomiya (a palace for Saigu to be purified), and in September of the next year, 1153, she went to Ise.

sen.j: 久寿2年（1155年）7月、近衛天皇の崩御のため退下した。
sen.e: In July 1155, she resigned by the death of Emperor Konoe.
In July 1155, she resigned by the death of Emperor Konoe.
In August 1155, she resigned because of the death of Emperor Konoe.
